group_1.textLeft: So what were you going to tell us?

group_1.textRight: First, the Hiroe family is undoubtedly descended @from the Mikoshibas.
Huh... @By Mikoshiba, you mean Granny Mikoshiba?

group_1.textLeft: Only those of the Mikoshiba clan can read that script.

group_1.textRight: Mom did tell me that we came from Tokime Village...

group_1.textLeft: But I never expected us to have come from the Mikoshibas...
After all, we Tokimes have been waiting for you.

group_1.textRight: We didn't come because of any reason like that, though?

group_1.textLeft: Even I wasn't aware of it until last night.
[textRed:'When the ones who can read the Mikoshibas' script appear,]
[textRed:'Up until that end arrives, the Diviners must forge a single sword.']
That's the legend passed down from Tokime to @Tokime.
We ended up deciphering the book after figuring out the village's whole situation,
but if we could've read that book in the first place, @we certainly would've figured out the entire plan...
And once that plan collapsed, we'd have to battle @the Wavering Deity...

group_1.textRight: Perhaps Shizuka's and Charu's families were collaborating with each other in the past?
But they were banished after being exposed, @and lived outside as the Hiroes...

group_1.textLeft: In my family, they continued sharpening the blade...

group_1.textRight: And in my family, they kept passing down the Mikoshibas' script...
This is the treasured sword which the Tokime @Diviners have infused with their power for @generations!
Use all the power that's been stored in it over @100, 200, 300 years,
and set the Wavering Deity free.

group_1.textLeft: This will be our final battle.

group_1.textRight: Everyone who infused their emotions into the sword must be wandering as the Wavering Deity.

group_1.textLeft: Let's take these bright feelings they once held, @and give them all back.

group_1.textRight: After who knows how many centuries' time!
